description: Reprints All-American Men of War #94 & Star Spangled War Stories #73
name: Be Brave--Be Silent!

description: Reprinted from All-American Men of War #104 and Our Army At War #196.
name: The Last Target

description: Reprints Star Spangled War Stories #50, #83 & #90.
name: Island of Armored Giants!

description: Reprints Our Army at War #30, #57 and #79.
name: The Silent Gun

description: Reprints GI Combat #72, and Our Army at War #11 and #78.
name: The Three Frogmen!

description: While everyone tries to adjust to Dragon's death, Bludgeon II turns to his brother and She-Dragon in order to find a way to lose his powers.
She-Dragon and the rest of the Chicago Police Force are defeated by the God Squad, who seek to retrieve the Earthly offspring of the Gods and take them back to Godworld.

After William and Rita announce their engagement, Alex reconciles with Chris, prompting She-Dragon to seek a cure for Bludgeon's monstrous condition amongst Johnny Redbeard's leftover machinery, in order to win back Chris' attention.
Mere minutes after arriving on Godworld alongside S.O.S. and Brute Force, and rescuing those from Earth held there, Kill-Cat manages to destroy it. Radical and countless Gods die as a result.

As Chris and Alex end their relationship, Widow announces that she is having Radical's baby, Smasher quits S.O.S. (a vacancy filled by Mace), and the new Overlord prevents Octopus' crew from taking his armor.
While visiting the remains of his fallen comrades, Herakles discovers their bodies are being eaten away by maggots.
Overlord obliterates Ralph Johnson, after which Dragon attempts to rescue Rita, doing battle with the clearly weakened Overlord, who flees the scene.

Dragon/William recovers in hospital, where he learns that Rita is pregnant with Ralph's baby. As Smasher confeses her love for Dragon, Rock confronts Kill-Cat about the destruction of GodWorld, and it is revealed that Kid Avenger (who is fired from the team) was the cause.
Powerhouse decides to manipulate Dragon into battling Overlord for them, and something mysterious starts to happen to Simon Kane at a Government facility...
Simon Kane posesses the body of Darklord's former henchman Devastator and uses it to escape from captivity.

After Dragon and the Chicago branch of S.O.S. prevent BrainiApe and a group of neo-Nazis from seizing Chicago City Hall, Barbaric and several Police officers take Dragon to a strip club for his bachelor party, where the festivities are interrupted by someone who appears to be Rapture, who claims to have been transformed into pure energy when she was "killed" by Darklord, and inhabited the body of her friend (and recent S.O.S. recruit) Lightning.

Overlord interrupts Dragon's wedding, and slaughters his bride... or at least, the person everyone believes to be his bride. In actuality, Smasher was kidnapped and replaced by Impostor, and is currently held captive by The Covenant of the Sword.

Dragon, retired from superheroics and living in a maximum-security home, fights off several attempts on his life. After Angel is maimed in an attack by Overlord, Dragon tries to track him down, only to be captured by him in the process.

After Dragon learns that Nixon put on Overlord's amor to spy on Rita before it turned him evil, and that he had beaten and chained Super-Tough in order to coerce Mace's allegiance, he has the armour incinerated.
While Dragon, who has settled down with Marcy and Angel, laments a return to crimefighting, Sgt. Marvel surmises that a recent rash of suicides is the work of Simon Kane.

After an unsuccesful get-together at William & Rita's where Angel insults their ugly child, she and Dragon are visited by Mighty Man / Ann Stevens. Follwing the revelation that Dragon and Alex are once again 'involved,' Dragon answers a Police report detailing a bank robbery. While confronting the villain in question, Dragon and an innocent bystander fall victim to the crook's weapon - a leftover Martian shrinking ray.

Justice, severely beaten and possibly dying, arrives at a hospital, where he tells SuperPatriot that Liberty is held captive the the Covenant of the Sword, who are building their own 'master race.'

SuperPatriot decides to fry Darklord while he's still a child, before the tyke can grow up to become the murderous dictator of all of Earth. To make things much, much worse, Darklord is his grandson.
name: Superpatriot Vs. Darklord Round 1

description: Angered that she cannot receive a commitment from Dragon, Alex apparently 'dumps' him at his house - where he then finds Powerhouse waiting for him. Dragon and Powerhouse then engage in a furious and prolonged battle, all the while debating their respective ideologies.

The stranded Gods of Asgard ache for a new home. They plan to take the occupied city of Atlantis. Fearing for the lives of the sentient beings of that city, the Dragon wishes to take the Special Operations Strikeforce of Chicago to stop the Gods. However, he soon learns that the Vicious Circle owns Chicago, right down to the SOS. Despite this, he gets a squad out. The Gods murder their way into taking Atlantis, though thankfully the fatalities are few. Dragon is put into the hospital.

The hits just keep on coming. Savage Dragon's latest girlfriend, Mighty Man, is laid to rest after her brutal murder. His daughter is taken away by the authorities and he is forced to kill Cesspool in self-defense. Dragon decides to assist in an effort to rescue SuperPatriot from a Covenant stronghold.
Dragon tries to protect four innocent women from various threats, including a sixty foot tall version of his former friend Rita! And just when things get a little bit better, Martians invade. Again!
name: Attack of the 60-Foot Woman!

description: The Lurkers beneath Lake Michigan. In the new Savage World, the Dragon gets sucked under the surface of the deadly Bay of Bones and enters an underwater kingdom like no other. Enter: The Atlantean and a fantastic underwater realm like you've never seen before. Powerful forces vie for control of the planet and the Savage Dragon is the only one who can hope to save this ravaged world from annihilation. The Dragon tries to puzzle out what happened to his home but can even he begin to make things right again?
name: The Lurkers Beneath Lake Fear!

description: Enter: GROKK the giant sea monster that walks like a man. In the deadly Bay of Bones the Dragon fights for his life and the survival of a fantastic underwater kingdom. Sea monsters are eating away at the very Earth's core and the Savage Dragon is the only hope to save this ravaged world from complete annihilation. Time is running out-- air is running out-- and the Dragon just may be in over his head. Questions are answered and secrets are revealed in thi adventure. This issue is completely self-contained.
name: The Land Down Under!

description: Enter: The Bug-Riders. In the aftermath of an alien invasion, Martian enlarging rays have unleashed a horde of super-sized insects on our periled planet and the Savage Dragon is our only hope to save this ravaged world from complete annihilation! But can he stop their infestation without destroying the new order that's keeping a strange new society alive? Questions are answered and secrets are revealed in this adventure.
name: The Bug Riders!

description: Guest-starring Mike Allred's Madman. Held captive by the deadly new Vicious Circle, the Dragon must fight for his life in the arena of death. It's the Dragon versus Madman as the world watches! And with Madman along-- can the Atomics be far behind? Savage Dragon is featured in the Atomics this moth from AAA Pop Productions. These stories do not crossover from one book to another and both comics can be read and enjoyed independently of each other.
name: The Arena of Death!

description: Mike Allred's The Atomics and Madman guest star as the Dragon fights BrainiApe and the deadly new Vicious Circle in the arena of death. And readers are not going to believe who's behind all this insanity.
name: Breakout From Command "D"!

description: Peril in Pittsburgh! Mike Allred's The Atomics and Madman guest-star as the battle rages in the streets. What is the sinister secret that threatens the very lives of those he loves most?
name: Peril In Pittsburgh!

description: Mighty Man returns, but is he a friend -- or the deadliest foe the Dragon's ever faced? The bold new direction reintroduces one of the most popular characters of the last 60 years in comics.
name: The World's Mightiest Man

description: Introducing: The Seeker -- the deadliest bounty hunter alive. He's determined to bring in the Savage Dragon -- dead or alive. Meanwhile the Dragon finds himself in a strange city with very familiar unearthly inhabitants. The pieces of the large puzzle that Dragon's life has become are falling into place.
name: Havoc In The Hidden City

description: To Challenge the Gods! The Dragon vs. Thor, God of Thunder. He came to Earth to rape and pillage and the Dragon's determined to stop him. Also-- A threat to the continued existence of this Savage World. Herakles and gods galore. The Dragon caused the planet wide disaster and now he's determined to fix it as his travels lead him to the hidden city know as God Town. More pieces of the puzzle that is Dragon's life fall into place. More questions are answered.
name: To Challenge The Gods!

description: The Deadly Duo are back! The Motor City's lovable lunkheads are out to aid the Savage Dragon against the awesome menace of Neutron Bob, the living bomb-burst. The Dragon discovers that Detroit has miraculously survived the great disaster unscathed -- what sinister secret saved Motor City? More pieces of the puzzle fall into place. More questions answered.
name: Panic In Detroit

description: Traveling with Neutron Bob, Dragon finds his way to Chicago to enlist the help of the Vicious Circle in defeating Cyberface. When he arrives, he is attacked and forced underground, losing Bob along the way. Underground, he finds Rock, Feezle, Beast Boy and Widow, but in this reality, they have never met. Dragon tries to enlist their help, but they decide to not help Dragon. He wanders off in search of Pipe Town and the Vicious Circle and is attacked along the way by Dale Fisher, who has been mutated by someone known as "The Creator."
name: Homecoming

description: THINGS GET NASTY. RAPTURE returns to menace the Savage Dragon! In the war ravaged Chicago, Dragon finds that the deadly domino effect that resulted from killing a fiendish time-traveling foe meant the life of his former lover was spared. The only problem is-- in this Savage World things played out in an entirely different manner-- the super-powered prostitute became a vicious cold blooded killer and the unknowing Savage Dragon is her next intended victim! As always, this issue of Savage Dragon is COMPLETELY accessible to old and new readers!
name: Rapture

description:
Major Maxim and his thugs have entered the home of the wealthy antiquity collector Eddy Owen. They demand for him to reveal the location of the "artifact", but they fail to get any information out of him. After ransacking his house and destroying priceless belongings they knock him unconscious and seemingly leave. .

On the Danger Yacht, Deuce has rendevoued with the mysterious agent who helped Abbey and Sydney back in France. They exchange intel and the agent disappears, identity only known to Deuce.

Meanwhile the Danger Girls and Johnny Barracuda arrive to find the house turned upside down and Eddy lying on the floor. After explaining to Eddy why they have come, Abbey and the others are led to Eddy's secret hiding spot where he keeps the artifact - a golden medieval helmet. However, upon revealing its location, Major Maxim and his underlings spring out from the shadows to ambush the Danger Girls and try to steal the helmet. Major Maxim is badly hurt, and in the ensuing fight, Natalia is shot after Maxim orders the house buldosed. Major Maxim leaves victorious with helmet in hand.
name: Maximum Danger

description:
Overview

The Hulk, Namor, Silver Surfer, Dr. Strange,all in one book! Pluto is going to use the power of Valkyrie to resurrect an army of the dead and overrun the Earth, that is, unless Nighthawk and Hellcat can stop him!

Detailed Summary

We learn that months ago, Pluto visited Lorelei to ask for a favor. He wanted her to create a Valkyrie from a human, just as her sister the Enchantress had done years before. She agreed, in return for a share of the spoils from his plan.

Back in the present, Pluto employs this Valkyrie (Samantha Parrington) to raise the dead so that he can create a hell on Earth, which will allow him to have a mortal kingdom in addition to his kingdom in Hades. The Defenders watch in horror as they continue to be trapped in a magic pillar.

The rest of the Defenders suddenly appear, however, and free their friends. The original Valkyrie is among them. The two Valkyries battle, and the rest of the Defenders fight Pluto and the army of the undead.

It turns out that the "original" Valkyrie who just showed up with the Defenders was actually Lorelei, whom Pluto tricked after getting her to make the Parrington version. He turned Lorelei into a Valkyrie herself. Lorelei manages to absorb enough magic from Parrington to turn herself back to normal, and battles Pluto. Parrington manages to start to free herself from Pluto's spell now that he can't focus on her.

Meanwhile, the Defenders decide to destroy the temple that Pluto has been using for his magic--except after they do so, they find out that it was actually holding back the power of hell, and now all hell breaks loose!
name: The Armies of the Slain

description:
Overview

For the third time in a row: a classic Defender returns, but not in the way you think! As Pluto's legions of the dead storm the realm of the living, the truth about Valkyrie is revealed! Plus, in all likelihood, the Hulk will smack Namor upside the head.

Detailed Summary

The Defenders battle against Pluto's army of the undead, while he continues to fight against Lorelei. Suddenly, Brunnhilde the Valkyrie shows up at the head of an army of valkyries. Samantha Parrington finally breaks free of Pluto's spell and joins them. Between them, they manage to defeat the undead army.

Then Zeus shows up and Pluto and Lorelei flee.

Brunnhilde gives Parrington her sword and horse and tells her to carry on the name of Valkyrie among the Defenders; Brunnhilde goes back to Asgard.

Namor wants the others to come with him to Atlantis, which has been invaded by Attuma, but Dr. Strange reminds him that they (Strange, Namor, Surfer, and Hulk) have been cursed, and they may be pulled away to a new location by magic at any moment. Strange says they must research the curse. The "big four" Defenders argue and most of the split up, leaving Nighthawk, Parrington, Hellcat, and Strange as a team.
name: Ride of the Valkyrie

description:
Overview

While Dr. Strange wrestles with the Defenders' curse, Namor storms the bastions of Atlantis, determined to take his kingdom back from the conqueror Attuma! And with the Hulk and the Silver Surfer dealing with upheavals in their own lives, only Nighthawk, Valkyrie and Hellcat are available to meet the threat posed by the horrific Headmen!

Detailed Summary

Namor swims back to Atlantis and fights his way into Attuma's presence. He is angry that the other Defenders aren't there to help him.

Dr. Strange tries to figure out Yandroth's curse on the "big four" Defenders, and the others go out on the town to relax.

Meanwhile, the Defender's old villains, the Headmen, attack a museum and steal an ancient artifact. The Defenders show up and defeat them, but the Headmen manage to escape with the artifact.

Right when Namor finally attacks Attuma, the curse reactivates, and he, Strange, the Hulk, and the Surfer are once again teleported away.
name: Headhunt

description:
Overview

What is the threat to all reality that has summoned the Defenders? The team will find out... in the sky-citadel of the Red Raven! But, even if they discover the truth, will the curse that binds them prevent them from defeating the menace? Plus: look out, Hulk, it's the Bi-Beast!
name: Rumble in the Sky

description:
Overview

The Defenders confront a threat to all reality in the sky citadel of the Red Raven, and also attempt to restore Namor to the throne of Atlantis!
name: Fire Above, Thunder Below

description:
Overview

The curse has once again brought the Defenders together, but the Silver Surfer is missing! Dr. Strange, Namor and the Hulk blast off into space in search of their comrade, and run afoul of a star-born menace! Meanwhile, Nighthawk, Valkyrie and Hellcat hunt the Headmen -- but what they find instead might spell doom for the entire world!

Note: above the title, a review is placed saying "The worst comic ever produced". Marvel thought it was ridiculous that this was said over their title, not ever having heard this before, and laughingly added the review to the cover, as the company sometimes did with good reviews.
name: Day of the Great Ones

description:
Overview

The Headmen have taken over the world, and the Defenders' "big guns" are trapped in space! Now it's up to Nighthawk, Valkyrie and Hellcat to defeat the crazy-craniumed criminals!
name: While You Were Out...

description:
Overview

The Hulk, Dr. Strange, the Silver Surfer, and the Sub-Mariner return to a world enslaved by the horrific Headmen and the Unconquerable Orrgo! And wait'll you see what the freaky foes do to all the people who were mean to them in high school! Watchme, Yeah, right. Everyone knows that the post-modern deconstructionist masterpiece of the 21st Century is undoubtedly DEFENDERS!
name: Head to Head

description: The Demolition Run, a tale inspired by Jack "The King" Kirby himself, continues and Roxy's back! Can Superboy and Roxy survive long enough to catch up on old times or will the most dangerous race on any planet be the death of them both?
name: The Demolition Run, Final: Crash and Burn!

description: Superman shows up and is ready to give the Kid a lesson in Krypton history.
name: Mission to Krypton

description: Superman and Superboy head to Justice League headquarters to see everyone huddling around the dead body of... Superboy? From another place in Hypertime, the dying Teen of Steel leaves this world with a warning and an atomic power jacket tuned to his DNA. In order to get to the bottom of this, our Kid has to go where no Superboy has gone before...
name: Hyper-Tension! Part 1: Big Bang Theory!

description: Kon-El is on one wild trip as he encounters different versions of himself throughout Hypertime after every 5 minutes...
name: Hyper-Tension! Part 2: Superboy of Infinite Worlds

description: The story starts with Superboy trying to explain to the Kents, how he got to this place through Hypertime, but is now stranded. Clark offers him to stay. They can act like brothers, with the help of a new disguise of course. But then Black Zero arrives. He has a lot of Stormguards with him. They attack the two Superboys. Clark manages to catch a hyper-bullet, but gets teleported away alongwith Connor. At the Cadmus Labs, the scientists hold a meeeting. They feel the need of a replacement of Superboy. Superboy awakens inside Black Zero's HQ. To his astonishment, he sees lots of Superboy variants. Black Zero narrates his story. He tells that in his world, a Superman was present, but had died. So a clone was made. But the clone differed from Connor in that it grew to adulthood. This adult Superman was never accepted by the masses. So Superman renamed himself as Black Zero. He conquered his world and constructed his fortress out of Cadmus Labs. Now Black Zero plans to conquer other worlds. Superboy mocks him, telling that Zero would never be able to conquer his world. Black Zero gets irritated and responds. He opens a chamber, producing numerous Doomsdays...
name: Hyper-Tension! Part 3: Divided by Zero

description: Can Superboy somehow find a way to survive when Black Zero traps him in a room inhabited by an army of Doomsday clones? Plus, a long time supporting cast member makes the ultimate sacrifice. Don't miss the pulse pounding penultimate chapter to the epic adventure inspired by the works of Jack "The King" Kirby himself!
name: Hyper-Tension! Part 4: For Every World - A Doomsday

description: This is it! The explosive conclusion to the most epic Superboy adventure of all time. Can the Kid somehow find a way to defeat his most dangerous adversary, Black Zero, or will this powerful new villain be able to reshape Hypertime to match his own twisted vision?
name: Hyper-Tension! Part 5: Zero Tolerance

description: After his epic adventure through Hypertime, is Superboy no more? Project Cadmus looks for a new operative to take the Teen of Steel's place and a Who's Who of DC heroes are coming along for the ride.
name: Hyper-Tension! Epilogue: Out of Hyper-Time!

description: Superboy returns to the Wild Lands for a showdown with a dangerous enemy from his past! Meanwhile back at Cadmus, Guardian has his own problems.
name: Wild Hunt!

description: The Kid faces off with one of his most dangerous adversaries, King Shark, in the Wild Lands. Meanwhile, Guardian suddenly finds himself time shifted to World War II where he is surrounded by a cadre of Nazis, or so he believes.
name: Tooth & Claw

description: Things get crazy when a mystical gauntlet of steel causes Guardian to mistakenly think Superboy and the operatives at Cadmus are Nazis. Things get worse when the ill tempered Etrigan the Demon shows up.
name: Day of Judgement: Demons!

description: Superboy returns to Hawaii only to find that there's a new hero in town. Meet the stretching sensation known as the Uncanny Kana!
name: Hawaii--Hana Hou!

description: When Superboy confronts Superman about the secret he discovered the Man of Steel was concealing, their meeting is interrupted by a four-armed juggernaut who makes Goro from Mortal Kombat look like a teddy bear. Then, the Kid returns to Cadmus only to discover that a coup de tat has occurred.
name: The Evil Factory, Part 1: Evil Factory!

description: The sinister duo of Simyan and Mokkari have taken control of Project Cadmus and not even Superboy may be able to stop their diabolical plans.
name: The Evil Factory, Part 2: Prisoners of the Project!

description: Reinforcements have arrived. But when Superboy has to rely on the super-dog, Krypto, Grokk the Living Gargoyle, Angry Charlie, and the woman called Hex for help, things must be getting bad.
name: The Evil Factory, Part 3: The Hex Files

description: Control of Project Cadmus has been usurped by The Agenda. Now Superboy, backed by a cadre of his closest friends and erstwhile adversaries, plans to take it back! Don't miss the explosive conclusion to "The Fear Factory!"
name: The Evil Factory, Part 4: Point of No Return!

description: Story continued from Young Justice: Sins of Youth (2000) #1. Since Superboy's clone body cannot age, he is the only one not affected by the aging process the other members of Young Justice have been exposed to. But a deadly side effects may sideline him and keep him from taking on his malevolent doppleganger, Match, for the right to be Superboy. Plus, a long time supporting cast member meets their end and Superboy's life will never be the same again. Story continues in Superman, Jr./Superboy, Jr. (2000) #1.
name: The Evil Factory, Part 5: Game, Set & Match!

description: In the tragic aftermath of last issue's events, and the recent events in "Sins of Youth," Kon-El must deal with the realization that he must now live out his life as a normal boy and with the tragic loss of the woman he once loved.
name: My Greatest Adventure!

description: "The New Superboy!" Part 1 of 4. Guest-starring Guardian. A powerless Superboy heads into outer space on his first mission after losing his powers. He better hope those late night training sessions with Guardian pay off.
name: The New Superboy

description: "...into the Fire!" Part 2 of 4. Guest-starring Guardian. A powerless Superboy fights for his life in outer space. Meanwhile back at Project Cadmus, Guardian comes face-to-face with a demonic adversary whose fiery touch could mean death.
name: ... Into the Fire!

description: "Give me Liberty...!" Part 3 of 4. A powerless Superboy tries desperately to stay one step ahead of his alien pursuers and tries to find a way to free his friends from captivity. Meanwhile, major changes are taking place back at Project Cadmus.
name: Give me Liberty--!

description: It's Superboy vs. Kossak the Slaver! How can the Kid survive a one-on-one confrontation with this alien overlord without his super-powers?
name: The Power & the Prize!

description: The new fiery Roxy is free and she has a bone to pick with her old crush. Can Superboy reel in his fiery old flame before someone gets hurt?
name: Boiling Point

description: Can Superboy contain Roxy before she destroys the city, and will the presence of the Titans only complicate matters?
name: Fever Pitch

description:
The kid and Guardian head to the Big Apple. While Big G hangs out with Arsenal and catches up with his great-nephew, the Kid runs into a new villain with some heavy problems.

While Guardian is meeting up what could be his only family since his service at Cadmus, Superboy has to take down a teenager with gravity powers without ruining Jim's day.
name: Power Lunch

description:
There's no doubt, the Kid is in a rut. If none of his friends, employers, nor his mentor can help him...who can? Maybe a new costume will help.

Overview

Superboy might be facing something far worse than the latest super-villain or world threat: Is it possible he's become...unhip? Having fallen into a serious rut, Superboy begins to worry that what once made him the coolest Kid in the DC Universe has become so "five minutes ago." The action heats up when Superboy seeks advice from several guest stars from the DC Universe, including Steel, Superman, and his teammates in Young Justice. Superboy may have to resort to drastic measures if he hopes to ever reach "phat" status again, but the answers to his problems may force him to take a good hard look inside himself, discovering what really defines him.
name: How Kon-El Got His Groove Back

description: Guest-starring Batgirl and Batman. Superboy heads to Gotham City to hang out with Robin. But when the Boy Wonder is unavailable, the Kid instead meets up with Batgirl. One problem: The Dark Knight himself isn't too thrilled with that idea, so he puts Superboy through a series of tests to make sure he's on the up-and-up. Can the Kid make the grade?
name: Silent, But Deadly

description: Superboy heads south and winds up in the middle of the most offbeat wedding of all time. Plus, one of the Kid's closest friends meets his end.
name: Southern Cookin'

description: Out of respect for his friend's wishes, Superboy took the Guardian's DNA, preventing Project Cadmus from carrying out the U.S. government's orders to clone the fallen super-soldier. Unfortunately, the Kid's gonna have to face the DNAngels, a trio of genetically spliced lethal ladies, as well as pay the serious consequences for his actions...especially since he was a wee bit too late, and he's the guardian of a baby Guardian.
name: Da.Aa.B.O.M.

description: An "Our Worlds at War" tie-in! The Kid returns to Project Cadmus, only to find the Project is no more! Superboy also learns that a war is brewing, and the U.S. Government plans on turning thousands of proto-clones into Guardians! Naturally, the real Guardian and Superboy don't want that to happen but a new nasty calling himself General Good, along with the DNAngels, disagree.
name: Greed I$ Good

description: An "Our Worlds at War" tie-in! Superboy fights for his life in the War, holding the fate of the Guardian and his many proto-clones in his hands.
name: The One Where Superboy Makes An Important Choice!

description: Wonder Woman reconnects with Artemis. Plus, Diana must make a choiceimmortality or a mortal life as Earth's protector.
name: Gods and Monsters

description: In the thrall of Oblivion, Wonder Woman is powerless to stop his destructive rampage. Luckily, Superman and Batman come to her aid.
name: Trinity 98 Part 1

description: Wonder Woman, Superman and Batman form the greatest trinity of super heroes in the DCU, but can even they stop the mystical menace - Oblivion.
name: Trinity 98 Part 2

description:
Wonder Woman attempts to bring peace to a war-torn corner of the world with explosive results.

Tagline: Way of the Warrior
name: The Bearing of the Soul
